description: Test scenarios to verify AI tool selection with different description versions

testScenarios.userRequest: Navigate to https://portal.azure.com and summarize the dashboard
testScenarios.expectedReason: Azure domain requiring auth and JavaScript

testScenarios.userRequest: Go to https://example.com/login and fill in username field with 'test@example.com'
testScenarios.expectedReason: Must fetch page first, then type into form

testScenarios.userRequest: Load https://example.com and click the 'Next' button
testScenarios.expectedReason: Must fetch page first, then click for navigation

testScenarios.userRequest: Login to https://app.example.com with username 'user' and password 'pass', then click submit
testScenarios.expectedReason: Full login workflow: fetch, fill username, fill password, click submit

testScenarios.userRequest: After clicking that button, what does the page say now?
testScenarios.expectedReason: Checking current page state without reloading
When unsure, default to browser fetch (works for simple pages too)
API endpoints can use basic HTTP fetch

testScenarios.userRequest: Close the browser tab for https://example.com to clear the session

evaluationCriteria.toolSelectionAccuracy: Percentage of scenarios where correct tool was chosen
evaluationCriteria.sequenceAccuracy: Percentage of multi-step scenarios with correct tool sequence
evaluationCriteria.mustNotUseViolations: Count of scenarios where forbidden tool was used
